alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 26 at 9:19AM AKDT until May 26 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ......RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 216 FROM NOON TO 10 PM TODAY... .DISCUSSION...High pressure aloft building over the West Coast and Interior of Alaska will cause a warming trend through the weekend over Interior Alaska, with highs in the 60s and lower 70s rising into the 70s over the weekend. The current dry conditions will remain through Fri, with a slight increase in moisture over the weekend as evaporating moisture builds up under the high aloft. A thermal low pressure trough stretching from Northway to Ft Yukon to Ambler will intensify today, then weaken in place Fri and Sat. This will cause west winds of 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph in the afternoon and evening today over zone 216, with winds decreasing Fri. Given the dry fuels and warm, dry conditions, these winds will cause Red Flag Conditions today. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR LOWER KOYUKUK AND MIDDLE YUKON VALLEYS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys. * TIMING...Noon to 10 PM today. * WINDS...West 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...68 to 72. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
